medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea and emesis with abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Nausea and emesis developed last night, followed by diarrhea. Abdominal pain did not develop until the patient awoke mid-day, initially periumbilical, then localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) in the late afternoon. The pain is constant and sensitive to movement, including straightening legs. No fever or chills reported. No prior episodes.
medical_history.family_history: Melanoma in father and grandfather; breast cancer in grandmother; liver cancer in grandfather.
